comment._content: What makes  only a 3rd class Chaplain?

comment.author: 69662531@N05
comment._content:
From the Commonwealth War Graves Commission website:

Name:WILKS, THE REVD. WALTER CHARLES
Initials:W C
Nationality:United Kingdom
Rank:Chaplain 3rd Class
Regiment/Service:Army Chaplains' Department
Secondary Regiment:South Staffordshire Regiment
Secondary Unit Text:attd. 7th Bn.
Age:35
Date of Death:04/10/1917
Awards:M C
Additional information:Son of Samuel Hawes Wilks and Maria Nice Wilks.
Casualty Type:Commonwealth War Dead
Grave/Memorial Reference:V. A. 1.
Cemetery:BARD COTTAGE CEMETERY

comment.author: 11953092@N04
63191264@N00
comment._content:
The 1901 census records Walter as a 19 year old Assistant Chemist living at 32 Wellington Road, Bridlington, East Yorkshire, with his parents Samuel Hawes Wilks [b.1837 d.1913], Maria NiceWilks nee Allen [b.1844 d.1911] his older sisters Ellen [b.1866], Emilia [b.1879] and seven boarders and a visitor. His father’s occupation is given as Commercial Traveller in Wholesale Grocery [and still recorded in the 1913 Kelly’s Directory as living at the address].
From 1903 to 1905 Walter was a student at the Wesleyan College, Headingly, Leeds [renamed Hinsley Hall and now the Catholic Diocese Pastoral & Conference Centre].
His name is recorded on the dedication plaque for a stained glass window at the Hall.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/johnnyg1955/4055192973/in/set-72157622670617212]
His 1901 home still exists although now converted in to flats.
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/liits/6486728687/]

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/69684435@N07] 3rd Class CF3 = Major They have grades which equate to the standard ranks and wear the insignia of the equivalent rank. Chaplains are usually addressed as "Padre"never by their nominal military rank. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Royal_Army_Chaplains%27_Department#...
